Pelatih Anyar Timnas Indonesia Disebut Harus Paham Sepak Bola Indonesia
07 Nov 2019, 00:55 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Joko Susilo membeber pendapatnya soal sosok yang paling tepat menjadi Pelatih Timnas Indonesia, menggantikan Simon McMenemy. Asisten Pelatih Timnas Indonesia tersebut mengaku ada syarat yang harus dimiliki sosok nakhoda anyar Skuad Garuda, julukan Timnas Indonesia.
"Pelatih harus mengetahui kebutuhan dan karakter sepak bola Indonesia," ucap Joko Susilo, pada Bola.net.
"Saya tidak bisa menyampaikan secara detail pada publik. Namun, jika diminta, saya akan sampaikan detail pada Direktur Teknik PSSI," sambungnya.
Lebih lanjut, Joko mengaku dua nama yang disebut berpeluang besar jadi pengganti McMenemy, Luis Milla dan Shin Tae Yong, sama-sama memiliki kualitas apik.
"Dua orang ini sama-sama bagus. Mereka punya pengalaman internasional," tutur Joko.
"Namun, mereka pun sama-sama perlu waktu. Jika ada sosok lain pun, termasuk jika ada pelatih lokal, mereka tetap memerlukan waktu. Tak hanya waktu, mereka pun perlu biaya dan sarana yang menunjang," imbuhnya.
Sebelumnya, Komite Eksekutif PSSI memutuskan untuk mengganti Pelatih Tim Nasional Indonesia, Simon McMenemy. Pelatih asal Skotlandia ini digeser karena dinilai gagal membawa Timnas Indonesia meraih hasil positif dalam Kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022.
PSSI sendiri bakal segera mencari pelatih untuk mengisi posisi yang ditinggalkan McMenemy. Pelatih anyar ini dijadwalkan bakal menangani Skuad Garuda, julukan Timnas Indonesia, usai laga kontra Timnas Malaysia, Rabu (19/11) mendatang.
Ada sejumlah nama yang saat ini ditimang-timang sebagai pengganti McMenemy. Selain mantan Pelatih Timnas Indonesia, Luis Milla, ada juga sosok pelatih asal Korea Selatan, Shin Tae Yong.

Anyar Indonesia National Team Coach Called Must Understand Indonesian Football
Nov 7 2019, 00:55 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Joko Susilo revealed his opinion about the most appropriate figure to become the Indonesian National Team Coach, replacing Simon McMenemy. The assistant coach of the Indonesian national team admitted that there was a condition that had to be had by the new skipper of the Garuda Squad, nicknamed the Indonesian National Team.
"Coaches must know the needs and character of Indonesian football," Joko Susilo said on Bola.net.
"I cannot convey the details to the public. However, if asked, I will convey the details to the PSSI Technical Director," he continued.
Furthermore, Joko admitted that the two names mentioned had a great chance to replace McMenemy, Luis Milla and Shin Tae Yong, who both had neat qualities.
"These two people are equally good. They have international experience," said Joko.
"However, they also need time. If there are other figures, including if there are local trainers, they still need time. Not only time, they also need funds and supporting facilities," he added.
Previously, the PSSI Executive Committee decided to replace the Indonesian National Team Coach, Simon McMenemy. The Scottish coach was shifted because it was considered a failure to bring the Indonesian national team to achieve positive results in the 2022 World Cup Qualifiers.
PSSI itself will soon be looking for a coach to fill the position left by McMenemy. This brand-new coach is scheduled to handle the Garuda Squad, the nickname of the Indonesian national team, after the match against the Malaysian national team, Wednesday (11/19) future.
There are a number of names that are currently being hobbled in place of McMenemy. In addition to the former Indonesian national team coach, Luis Milla, there is also the figure of a South Korean coach, Shin Tae Yong.
